info.author: Kexin Xie
classifiers: Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
# S3Query

S3Query opens file or files in s3 file system as text file, will perform unzip
if necessary. It also handles hadoop liked part-\* files and treat all files
within a directory as one single file.


# Example

    >>> from s3query import s3open
    >>> import sys
    >>>
    >>> with s3open("s3://s3query/data/testgz/") as fgz:
    ...     for line in fgz:
    ...         sys.stdout.write(line)
    ...
    one
    two
    three
    four
    five
    six
    seven
    eight
    nine
    >>> with s3open("s3://s3query/data/test/") as fplain:
    ...     for line in fplain:
    ...         sys.stdout.write(line)
    ...
    one
    two
    three
    four
    five
    six
    seven
    eight
    nine
info.name: s3query
info.summary: Read parted and encrypted S3 files like a single file object
info.html_description:
# S3Query

S3Query opens file or files in s3 file system as text file, will perform unzip if necessary. It also handles hadoop liked part-* files and treat all files within a directory as one single file.

# Example

>>> from s3query import s3open
>>> import sys
>>>
>>> with s3open("s3://s3query/data/testgz/") as fgz:
...     for line in fgz:
...         sys.stdout.write(line)
...
one
two
three
four
five
six
seven
eight
nine
>>> with s3open("s3://s3query/data/test/") as fplain:
...     for line in fplain:
...         sys.stdout.write(line)
...
one
two
three
four
five
six
seven
eight
nine
